value.title: DAX Fridays! #127: Calculate Same period last Month in DAX
value.excerpt: Comparing periods is something you should always do as it adds context to your data, but how do you calculate Same period last month? PREVIOUSMONTH function will give you the entire previous month, so how do you do it? #powerbi #curbal #dax #daxfridays  Here is  one of the many ways to do it.   Get Northwind

value.title: DAX Fridays! #136: Correlation in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you what correlation is and how to calculate it in power bi, as well as show you the correlation custom visual. #powerbi #curbal #dax #daxfridays  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays survey: http://bit.ly/2MMM4KK    Here

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #148: CONVERT and resolve variant data-type error
value.excerpt: Have you got this error in Power BI? "Expressions that yield variant data-type cannot be used to define calculated columns". If you have, check this video to learn how to fix it using the new DAX function CONVERT.  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays

value.title: DAX Fridays! #17: DATEDIFF
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to calculate the difference between two dates using DATEDIFF. I also show you how to overcome the issue when the start date is larger than the end date.  PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ykkaAtlCMc NEXT VIDEO: -  Link to demo file: http://gofile.me/2kEOD/G4FzzQLvV

value.title: DAX Fridays! #179: Use a slicer to highlight values instead of filter them in Power BI ðŸ˜Ž
value.excerpt: Did you know that you can use a slicer in Power BI to highlight values instead of filtering them?  Let me show you the technique here, but if you are up for it, give it a go before and let us know what you came up to!  Pass multiple values from a slicer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_k_Qxb6pyCc  iscrossfilter

value.title: DAX Fridays! #181: Can't covert text into dates using DAX? Here is why...
value.excerpt: You should use power query to convert text into dates in power bi, but if you have a direct query or live connection and you need to do it in DAX, here is a tutorial of what works, what doesnt and what to watch for.  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?  This scenario is often called role playing dimensions and in this video I will show you two ways to solve it. :) Happy Friday!!  Links to videos mentioned: Introduction to data modeling:

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #212: VALUES vs SELECTEDVALUE to conditional format a line chart
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you the dax needed to conditional format a line chart in Power BI and by doing that, I will show you the difference between SELECTEDVALUE and VALUES.  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power

value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX.  This function is useful to detect when a column has been filtered and as shown in this video you can use it to set conditions when a column has been filtered.  Link to Power BI file: http://gofile.me/2kEOD/jSGFzsbB3  PREVIOUS VIDEO: USERELATIONSHIP

value.title: DAX Fridays! #27: RELATED vs RELATEDTABLE
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will go through two functions in DAX, related and relatedtable.  We will explain how they both work and when to use one or the other.  Link to Power BI file used in the video: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/related-dax  EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column.  Link to Power BI file used in the video: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/search-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #40: DATESINPERIOD (Moving x Months average)
value.excerpt: In today's video we will learn how to use DATESINPERIOD function using Moving Average calculation.  First we will explain what a Moving average 3 months is and how it is calculated.  Later on we will build a measure that will explain how datesinperiod is used.   EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Beginners - SUM Vs SUMX in Power BI - What, When and Where?
value.excerpt: Welcome to Wed with Dax beginner series. During this episode, we will talk about two interesting DAX expressions. SUM and SUMX. We will compare both DAX expressions in detail. First, I will explain When to use SUM and when to use SUMX. We will talk about the difference between SUM and SUMX functions
